page.title: 03The Shropshire Union Canal
page.content: The towpath runs up one side of the canal, where the horses walked along when they were pulling the barges. It is now over-grown. Along the side of the towpath is a stable where the horses were kept overnight. Opposite this is the old wharf where barges used to load and unload their goods. The old pub is above the wharf and is now a house. The canal area is a very popular place to live and many of the old houses have been done up. By the wharf, on the bottom of the canal bed, are the remains of a sunken barge. There are 2 basins which are wider parts used to turn around. We saw many birds and quite a few animals. There were also many different types of wild flowers and trees.
